verses.roman:
kṛṣṇa-tulya bhāgavata--vibhu, sarvāśraya
prati-śloke prati-akṣare nānā artha kaya

synonyms: kṛṣṇa-tulya bhāgavata—Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam is identical with Kṛṣṇa; vibhu—the supreme; sarva-āśraya—the origin of everything, or that which controls everything; prati-śloke—in every verse; prati-akṣare—in every syllable; nānā artha kaya—there are varieties of imports.
translation: "Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam is as great as Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Lord and shelter of everything. In each and every verse of Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam and in each and every syllable, there are various meanings.
